intro: Callista nutans, commonly known as the nodding callista, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that hang in clusters, often with a faintly fragrant scent. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a leathery texture with a distinct aromatic odor when crushed. Callista nutans is typically found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments.
